review.itemreviewed: Hyper Hiker Low Hiking Shoe - Little Kids'
review.reviewBody:
Take care with the sizing. Smaller than other Adidas models. 
We bought online for 4yr old daughter. She was happy with the fit and colour. We thought they looked smart but there was no room for growth. We ordered them in the same size (10k) as the Adidas Grand Court 2.0 trainers we bought recently which still have some room. We were therefore surprised to find these Terrex shoes are a good half a size smaller. 
We were pleased with the shoe otherwise so we have ordered a larger size (10.5k) in a similar model (since no availability in the same model).
Star off off for the hassle of returning, and because we don't yet know how they will perform.
review.name: Returned - slightly too small.

review.reviewBody:
Let's dive into these Fjallraven Keb Eco-Shell trousers I recently bought, because boy, do we have some issues. Sure, they look solid, and the build quality is exactly what you'd expect from Fjallraven - top-tier. I've always appreciated the craftsmanship Fjallraven brings to the table, and these trousers aren't an exception in that regard.

But here's where things go south. I've been a loyal Fjallraven fan for a while, rocking their Keb trousers in size 50, and they've always been a perfect fit. So, with the same confidence, I ordered these Eco-Shell trousers in my usual size M. What I got was a waist fit that felt custom-made but a length that felt like it was designed for a giant.

It's not just a little extra fabric we're talking about; these pants are unreasonably long. And believe me, the irony isn't lost on me. I've got this high-quality, stylish pair of trousers that I can't wear because of the absurd length. The worst part? The sizing guide led me to believe these would be a perfect fit.

Now I'm stuck with these excessively long, expensive trousers, and I can't help but feel disappointed and let down. It's a bitter pill to swallow, especially considering the steep price tag.

In a nutshell, these Fjallraven Keb Eco-Shell trousers have left a sour taste in my mouth. They've got the aesthetics, the quality, but the fit - especially the length - is a total disaster. If you're planning on getting a pair, heed my warning: don't trust the sizing guide blindly or better yet, try them on in-store first. Don't end up with the same regret I'm dealing with.
review.name: Falling Short on Fit

review.reviewBody:
It can protect from rain and wind. It's may have long inseam but it can boot hook on my boot's lace. I wish they have a Deep Forest color in USA because I saw that in Europe website and I didn't know.
Last weekend, I went to summiting Misti, Arequipa in the desert there're spike plants and they didn't pick on my legs thank to pants' material.
review.name: Great rain pants

review.reviewBody: I do not quite understand the concern of the other reviewer. Don’t be put off. Because I also have a 30” inseam, however find these rain pants to be no issue whatsoever as they feature a draw cord adjustment at the bottom. Therefore they can be cinched tightly around the ankle, making them a perfect fit. In terms of performance, they are excellent. I got a size XS and have a 29” waist, and thanks to the adjustment options, they can be worn either over the top of my thick vidda pros, or a smaller base layer. They breathe really well, and keep the rain out, and you nice and warm. These will last a lifetime. If you only want one pair of rain pants, these are hard to beat.
review.name: Superb Rain Pants

name: Keb Eco-Shell Trouser - Men's

review.reviewBody:
First the negatives: for some reason, these shoes do not work with my Favero Assioma pedals + Look Keo cleats. They do work with the Expedo RC7 cleats in the Assioma pedals (the ones the pedals came with). I think it's because the bottom of the shoe is flatter than my previous shoe, and so torquing the cleat warps it in a way that prevents engagement of the pedals. This isn't necessarily the fault of the shoe, though. Other negative is minor: the BOA dial only goes one way - the BOA on my previous shoe went both directions, which was nice for on the fly adjustment.

Positives:
If you have wide feet, just click 'buy'. I didn't realize it until I tried these shoes, but I had fit problems that came from trying to angle my wide feet to put power through a narrow platform. These shoes are WIDE (I have 4E flippers and they fit me), and fit true to the Shimano size chart (their conversion is different than others, check their chart specifically). I don't know why the description says they run small - they fit me true to size. They are light, stiff, comfortable, breathable, and look much better than I expected. The upper BOA enclosure + velcro strap is like a glove where it counts without also over-tightening across the wide area of the foot. I'm normally of the camp that paying more for shoes is pretty pointless for the average cyclist, but I'm very happy I went one step up from the $100 range of my previous shoe.
review.name: If you have wide feet, get a wide shoe

name: RC502 Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I will be returning this, it is not cute and it bulky. also the coral color seems weird. I've never owned overalls before but I bought these for summer time bike riding, dog walking, gardening, etc and I feel like these are too thick and bulky, they won't be comfortable especially in the heat.

I am 5'4, 130lbs and XS fit. (i usually wear XXS or XS in patagonia)
review.name: bulky fit

review.reviewBody: Quick delivery. Saw these overalls in Patagonia store but didn’t have correct size. Couldn’t find online except for here. So happy they had it! Purchased as a gift for a friend. She loved them & was happily surprised with the huge butt pockets! Not sure if she’ll use those pockets but she loves wearing the overalls.
review.name: Adorable!

review.reviewBody: I bought these overalls in 2020 and still wear them to this day! I noticed the "Umber Brown" color is no longer available as an option, but the "Basin Green" is a nice neutral color. I only wear these overalls when I plan to get my hands dirty in soil or community work outside. I feel extremely comfortable in these and love the look of them with my boots. Now, I have to make a suggestion to anyone considering buying these overalls and has taken the time to read this review. Before you place these in the washer and dryer, be sure to tuck the straps into the zippered pocket on the front (and then partially zip it closed), so that you don't end up finding a broken buckle in the dryer like me. I use a hair scrunchie now and functions the same (just less cute).
review.name: Worn for Gardening Purposes Only

review.reviewBody:
I am in my overall era of life right now. There are few things I love more than a good paid of bib overalls in a cute color so I was so excited to see these. I bought the mauve color and could hardly wait until they arrived. They fit well which is a pleasant surprise as I am typically between S and M or 6 and 8 in Patagonia pants but the small is perfect. I loved the zippered pocket (few things worse than undoing your bibs to use the bathroom and emptying the contents of your pockets onto the bathroom floor. Looking at myself from the side, I like the way they fit in the bum area. My challenge is where the buttons are on the sides. They hit right at the widest part of my body and add a lot of bulk. The sides also are just a little too low so if I wear a cropped shirt, the shirt is too short to tuck in and too long to be neatly above the waist line, but that is an easy accommodation as I have many shirts.
I am wearing them around the house with the tags on and still unsure of whether on not I will keep them,
review.name: Quality but unflattering

review.reviewBody: Obsessed with these overall shorts, great quality and so cute. Love the green color. I do they think they run a little big I got size small and Im 5 9 135 pounds
review.name: Love these overalls!

review.reviewBody: I love the color and quality of these overalls. I ordered the Kale color in a size xs. My only complaint is the sizing. I am 5?4? 110-115 a true size 2 or 25 and petite. These are a tad too big in waist and all over. Undecided whether I will keep or get tailored. I wish Patagonia would offer an xxs in this product or petite sizing in certain products that run larger.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Tried a small and xs and kept the xs. I?m usually a solid small but I never know with Patagonia so I always have to try both sizes. These seemed to run big at least for my body type (5?9?, 120 pounds 32 aa chest). I love these with a close fitting tank or a crop top. I?ve even worn a loose sweater underneath it in the chilly morning. I?m considering a second color since I haven?t taken the cream color off yet!
review.name: Haven?t taken them off yet

review.reviewBody:
I am a huge fan of overalls. They are an easy go-to and flatter me well. These are really well made, the organic cotton is durable but not too thick. I was worried the seams/stitching around the crotch area would look a little weird but it doesn't at all.

From what I have found, in most Patagonia, definitely size down from what you might think. I wear a size 2 in the Stand Up Cropped Pant. I ordered these in an XS and they fit perfect. I am about a 27 inch waist, 26 on a good day lol, but I do have just a little bit bigger hips (37 inches I think). I had ordered a size S in the full-length stand up overall from Patagonia's site and they just fit a little to big hence why going for the XS with these. I like to fold up the legs on these overall shorts just one time to look more flattering on my shorter legs.

For reference, I also wear a size XS in Carhartt's overalls.
review.name: Living in these

name: Stand Up Overall - Women's

review.reviewBody: Nice cable locks.  Ibiught it to add a little extra security to the bikes while on our hitch rack.  I like that ican re-core the lock to match the integrated locks on the rack - BUT - I'd like it better if Thule would have matched them for me when I ordered them (together) or had an exchange program!  The lock is easy to use and the coated cable prevents scratches to the bikes.  It's added deterrent to theft when we haul the bikes and have to stop.
review.name: A Little Extra Security

review.reviewBody: I bought this a couple years ago to secure bikes to the back of my travel trailer during transport so they wouldn't grow legs while stopped overnight. Buddy needed to leave his dirtbike out of the truck for a night while camped so we locked it to my bumper with this, next day I could not get it unlocked so ended up smashing it with an axe so we could separate the dirtbike and leave camp... Will not be buying any Thule standalone lock/cables.
review.name: Don't waste your money

review.reviewBody: Excellent construction, the lock mechanism stuck a bit but after cycling it a few times it was good.
review.name: Our 2nd Thule cable lock

review.reviewBody: This cable lock is nice and compact which makes it great as a backup to keep for on the road. The only challenge is you will have to deal with fighting the coils out to utlize the full length, it was a bit annoying the first use on a bike rack with two bikes.
review.name: Handy to Have a Spare

review.reviewBody: The advertising says it will take 40 pounds off the weight of lifting the kayak. This is exactly correct. My 44 pounder lifts to the roof with ease. My back thanks you.
review.name: Easy set up. Works as advertised

review.reviewBody: Very good quality and would work well for a few bikes on a hitch rack or standing bikes.  It was shown as a good solution for a tailgate lock for bikes, but nowhere near long enough to serve this purpose.  I should have measured first and realized it was too short for this.  For a tailgate, 6" is long enough for one way, but not long enough to for through the bed lockdowns and loop back to lock.
review.name: Not Long Enough

review.reviewBody: I have installed these many times as I switch out locks between accessories.  If the lock core is installed properly, you can NOT use the master/installation key to remove the core when it is LOCKED.  The person giving 1 star may have a faulty accessory or did not install the core all the way.  Or is was unlocked. ;)
review.name: Works as stated

review.reviewBody: Replaced original rubber mounts that wore out
review.name: Better design then their old ones

review.reviewBody: I would love the option to order rubber headed keys for replacements/spares
review.name: great process for ordering Parts

name: Cable Lock 6ft One-Key System

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Covers my 55L pack with room to spare, there's even a bit of extra room for my 65L pack. I've only run it through 1 heavy rain, but it worked great and kept my bag as dry as can be. As someone on a SAR team, I'd prefer if it was available in a brighter color, but that's my only issue with it.
review.name: Covers my 55L pack with

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the Osprey Ultralight Raincover Medium for my Talon 44 backpack for a hike on Mt. Fuji, where rain is quite common, and I was thoroughly impressed. The rain cover fit my backpack perfectly and kept it completely dry throughout the hike. 

One of the standout features is its ease of use. Despite its compact storage bag, which might make you question if you can repack it, I found it simple to get the rain cover back into the bag with no effort. 

The quality of the rain cover is exceptional; it’s durable and effectively shields the backpack from the rain. I highly recommend this rain cover over others due to its reliable performance and high-quality construction. It’s a fantastic addition to any hiking gear and ensured that my gear stayed dry even in challenging conditions.
review.name: I purchased the Osprey Ultralight

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This product has worked well for me, keeps my bag dry. It has the extra benefit of covering the edges of the mesh in the pack so keeps me a tiny bit warmer when in use.

review.reviewBody: I am very disappointed in this tbh. My son always tries to grab my cup so I wanted to get him one his size and when I saw they sold these I immediately bought one. You would think that the no spill straw holder would definitely be on the kids cups like the regular adult cups but it’s not! Straw comes right out and kid spills the drink everywhere! I would waste the $. Cute but not functional at all for a kiddo.

review.reviewBody: Perfect for smaller hands. Bought for my 4 year old grandson. He loves it. Said Memaw, you bought me a Stanley.

review.reviewBody: The Stanley is good for kids. The packaging is so cute it has a bare with a mesege

The lid does not have the straw gripper x for the straw spout like the adult cups do.  The design is very cute. Hopefully the lid can be updated in the near future.

review.reviewBody: My daughter wanted a Stanley because my husband and I both have the 40 oz tumblers. She got this as a gift and absolutely loves it. I think it’s helping her drink more water and she feels like she fits in having her own Stanley cup.

review.reviewBody:
I wouldnt wear these in temps below ~28 or so farnheit w.out another pair of gloves/insulation and like someone else said..probably not over 50 degrees maybe 55.

I rode for an hour in these  once or twice around 23 and my fingers were really cold. In temps from 30-50 though theyre fine.
review.name: Not bad

review.reviewBody: The gloves kept my hands warm but the finger lengths are too long -- Lots of slack in the finger tips.  The size was correct to fit over my palm, but my fingers are too short.
review.name: Fingers too long

review.reviewBody: These gloves are very windproof and warm.  They worked well and seem breathable during a recent ride in the 28-34 deg. F with wind.  Haven't tested them in the rain yet, but they were warm.  Fit is a little odd as they seem to be constructed of a shell, insulated middle and an inner glove which seem to be independent so there is some motion between layers, but they seem warm.  I like the high-vis aspect, the cut is a little snug in the width.  I normally wear an XL and these XL's seemed true to size though a little snug across palm.  Finger length and width were good.
review.name: Exceeded expectations

review.reviewBody: I've had several rides at 30F and these kept my hands nice and warm, but that warmth does cost some dexterity overall very satisfied and not wind chill
review.name: Warm gloves

review.reviewBody: Very small, size up. My palm is 20.5 cm and the large was too small. Might have been women?s sizes? I?m not a large man, so if I can wear XL gloves and size small everything else, something is wrong here. The fit seems good, and the quality is there. And they seem really warm, but if it was really really cold and I wanted to wear liners,  I think I would probably need XXL
review.name: Very very small

review.reviewBody: Hey, I'm admittedly a cold wimp, but I wore these for the first time today in 40 degree weather, WITH Smartwool liners, and my fingers were frozen by the end of the ride.  I like them otherwise, but not as warm as I thought they would be.
review.name: Not warm to me

review.reviewBody:
I got these gloves for when it is less than 30 degrees.  They work great - they wick away my sweat and keep my hands warm.  Not recommended for anything warmer than 40 degrees, but terrific for trail running in the winter.  I also use them for mountain biking when it gets cold - I keep them in my hydration pack for those days where my lighter windstopper gloves (Castelli) stop cutting it on the long downhills . . .   Terrific gloves for anyone looking for something for real activity in real cold.

It fits me perfectly - but I like a nice tight fit.  If in doubt you might want to size up.  (or if you have sausage fingers)
review.name: Winter Running and Biking Glove

review.reviewBody:
I don't think I've ever worn gloves as uncomfortable as these. The fingers are too long super skinny. I can't full  open my hand because the material on the palm
Is inflexible snd the thumb is cut incorrectly. Fingers cold in 45 degree temps / not even riding.  Too difficult to articulate move Mt to safety change gears, pull brakes, ride in the drops. Only gripping the tops is okay. Forget trying to grab chews out of your back pocket / the goofy fingertips are so long. Too bad. They match.  Look good , but not made for humans who use their hands. Nothing like the jackets and jerseys.
review.name: Ill fitting

review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of bulky lobster style gloves that aren't really that warm.  This glove is amazing!  I've worn it to fat bike in 23 degrees with wind and my hands stayed warm!  I had such better control of my bike than with bulkier gloves.  I'll wear these on cold road bike days too (temps in the 30s).  They do run 2 sizes small (finger length is short).  I typically wear women's XS and the men's Small fits.  My husband is typically a Large in everything and he needed an XXL in these. These were an excellent purchase.
review.name: My perfect cold weather bike glove!

name: C5 GORE-TEX Thermo Glove - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Class V Pathfinder Pull-On Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, tough construction. Perfect for whitewater boating. I especially like the built in key tether in the pocket. Nice touch.

review.itemreviewed: Class V Pathfinder Pull-On Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Excellent short, cool bright color. I wish northface would offer brighter colors like the emerald green color. Dark colors for the modern dude is outdated, i.e. blue-black-brown=boring and not for the modern dude. I wish I would have purchased a few more pairs as they sold out of my size.

review.itemreviewed: Class V Pathfinder Pull-On Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Based on the description of these shorts I was expecting them to be quite soft, however, the material was quite coarse. It does seem that they are good quality, but unfortunately, they did not fit me very well, so I had to return them.

review.itemreviewed: Class V Pathfinder Pull-On Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I really love these shorts. You can wear them for anything-grocery shopping, walking the dog, or just chilling at home. The length is perfect; I bought the 5-inch version, which hits right at mid-thigh, and I personally prefer shorts that show a bit of thigh. The color is also great. One thing to note is that they are actually a relaxed fit instead of the standard fit listed in the description, but it turned out to be exactly what I wanted, so it worked out perfectly. I ended up buying four different colors during the sale, so now I can mix and match!
review.name: My new go-to shorts for every occasion

review.itemreviewed: Class V Pathfinder Pull-On Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my 5th V pull on shorts from TNF, and I like them a lot. This is the only kind of shorts I wear, has cool patterns and it goes with any color T shirts. Sizes are very similar to other TNF shorts or shorts from other brands.
review.name: Cool pattern, goes with any t shirts.

description: Buy the Darn Tough Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Darn Tough Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: I own several pairs of these socks and they've held up for years. I wear them hiking and everyday - spring, summer, winter and fall. I love the way these socks feel and fit. They're warm, soft, and breathable. They hold their shape after many. many washes, unlike my smartwool socks that have loosened up over time. The seam on top of the foot prevents blisters in my hiking boots. I am a women's 8 and I purchased the medium.
review.name: Darn Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Hands down the best socks you will ever own. Backed by a lifetime warranty. WOW. I love the various styles, thickness, and lengths. They truly have a sock for every occasion. I use them for workouts, hiking, running around the park and running around town. I love them.
review.name: Darn Awesome

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Darn Tough has always made super comfy and reliable socks and I love the color options that these come with! I used these on my 100+ mile backpacking trip of The Highline in the Uintas and loved them. I did get some blisters, but I haven't in the past and I think that was more so because it rained the first two days and everything was a muddy/puddly mess the entire journey. My shoes and socks never fully got dry.
review.name: Darn Great

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great socks, hated spending $23 for a pair of socks but I love them!
review.name: Darn tough

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have several pairs of Darn Tough socks that I wear for long, as well as short, hikes.  They are comfortable, have no seam so no rubbing at the toe, and feel great with all of my hiking shoes.  They fit well and keep my feet cool.  I gave a pair to my hiking partner and she loves them, too.   We plan to take them on our long hike of the Pacific Crest Trail.
review.name: Great for hiking

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: My wife hikes all the time with her girl friends and so I have got her two different pairs of socks these and another brand. By far she loves and prefers these. I hope they last the way everyone brags. She also loved the fun colors. She wears a size 7.5 women's.
review.name: My Wife Loves Them

review.itemreviewed: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife who wanted to hike mores. She loves them.  She keeps reminding flow comfy they are. She also loves the colors it comes in. I?m just glad she doesn?t complain about her socks anymore.
review.name: Great socks

name: Hiker Micro Crew Cushion Sock - Women's

description: Buy the DAKINE Hot Laps Stealth Hip Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hot Laps Stealth Hip Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Hot Laps Stealth Hip Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This hip pack is hardly noticeable while riding. I use if for shorter rides and usually just carry a bottle on my bike then put my phone, keys, multi-tool, and maybe a gel or two in this pack. So I haven't used it to carry a second water bottle yet, but with the items mentioned it's like having nothing extra on. This works great for me, because I don't like having a phone loose in a pocket, even a zip pocket, while mountain biking.
review.name: Excellent low profile hip pack

review.reviewBody:
They should really give the waist size range on these types of bags.  Have all kinds of of backpacks with waist straps.  I'm no where near the limit on those.  Having a 36" waist, I still have a just a little space left on the Stealth.  No judgement, I no some others will not.  Stay away from the Hot Laps 1L.  I would assume all other Dakine Hot Laps Liter versions are on the slim fit side until they list the actual waist size.  Returning the 1L, the strap was right at 36", which made it too tight.  Honestly, if your waist is bigger than 36" I'd stay away from the Stealth as well.

That said the stealth will be a great bag that will ride under or over my jersey or random shirt and hold my flat kit, tube, and Co2 canisters as well as wallet, keys and such.  Too bad more people won't be able to use it.
review.name: Waist Strap 42" Fully Extended

name: Hot Laps Stealth Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: I don't understand why you can't make a size medium with the long inseam in a size 12/13 foot. Good waders but cater to commercial fisherman a little more until then you only get 3 stars

The Simms M's Tributary Waders - Stockingfoot are exceptionally comfortable and durable, instilling confidence to wade into rivers without worrying about water leaks. They offer peace of mind, allowing me to concentrate fully on fishing. Thank you, Simms, for crafting reliable gear for those of us who love spending time in the water.
review.name: Outstanding equipment, hands down!

review.reviewBody: They removed the gravel guard clip to the boots. Such a shame because I loved these waders. Cant beat them for the price. A lot of guys use them in the surf in the northeast and the waves will blow ur waders up without the clip
review.name: No gravel guard clips

review.reviewBody: Great fit and reasonable durability for professionals.  The price has gone up considerably but the quality has remained good.
review.name: Can't go wrong.

review.reviewBody: Very nice fitting loose waders I’m a bigger guy and they fit perfect. Product seems very good. I’ve only had 1 month hope it last a while
review.name: Solid waders

review.reviewBody: They are very nice fit great and not that expensive give them a 10 out of 10
review.name: Tributary Stockingfoot Chest Waders

review.reviewBody: I was happy with my 2022 tributary waders but had issues trying to re waterproof them so I sent them in. Simms said they needed to be replaced but that model was no longer available so they sent me the newest ones. I like them but I don't like that there is no longer a zipper for the inside pocket. The pant legs don't have the clips to clip to your boot laces and there is only 1 belt loop. I guess that some people may like those changes but I'm not really happy with them. I've only worn them 2 times since I got them. I like the way they perform but time will tell to see if they hold up.
review.name: Updated waders

review.reviewBody: Amazing waders for the price. True to size and very durable.
They leak in a few months of use.  Stayed in river yesterday for 4-5 hours and my legs and feet were completely wet. I would never recommend it to anyone.

Mine started leaking in the crotch on my 3rd trip out. Everyone said simms was the way to go.. hasn't been the case for me. They have been sitting in my storage container for almost two years now unused. Will simms repair them?
review.name: Leaky crotch

name: Tributary Stockingfoot Wader - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Cable Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: My favourite jumper ever. Stylish, warm, perfect length and thickness. The jumper is not short at all and offers great cover good 20cm below my waist. I am 174cm tall, went for XS, although I am usually M and this fits perfectly. Very pleased.
review.name: Övik Cable Knit Roller Neck W

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Cable Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm, but the fit is nothing like in the pictures. Nowhere near as long as shown, and bells out strangely at the bottom. Not flattering at all. I own several fjallraven sweaters and tops, and this one falls horribly short.
review.name: Not as shown

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Cable Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought this for Christmas for my wife ,, it is very good quality and very warm . She is 5’ 1 and I ordered a size small and it fits perfect.
review.name: Quality

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Cable Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: Yowza! The beachy/mountainy/fishermany sweater of my dreamsss. I have the womens Ovik from two years back with the fair isle design on the shoulders. I ordered this in the same size (I am usually a Large, but I like my sweaters a little big, so I ordered them both in an XL). Perfect!! Important to note that compared to the fair isle Ovik, this one is shaped bigger and longer. The other one kind of hangs up lightly on my hips, whereas this one is loosey goosey and drapes off of my hips. The color is phenomenal creamy off-white. The wool is high quality. I have worn my older one hiking, backcountry skiing, weed pulling, home improvement projecting and it is still holding up wonderfully and almost never needs to be washed (yay wool!). I plan on treating this one with the same amount of love and thrashing. Killin it as always, Fjallraven!
review.name: Yes puhlease.

review.itemreviewed: Ovik Cable Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered M size, it runs little bigger then I though but that does not bother me. Feels cozy and pairs well with office pants and heals. This is my new favorite fall outfit item.
review.name: warmest thing to wear in the office

name: Ovik Cable Knit Roller Neck Sweater - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Sertig II Low GTX Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
CONS-NOT waterproof - Glue not holding all of the parts together. 
PROS : Durable upper, Durable sole, great lace engineering. 
Subjective - Looks Decently good and Very comfortable. 

Bottom line - The shoe is not waterproof and has some glue issues but is very tough, even against brutal terrain. MY fit was very good and it looks fairly good. laces stay tied :) I really wanted to love this shoe. :(

Let's start with the worst. The waterproofing is a fail. It took a while to figure this out, but both shoes are letting in water. It is NOT wicking or water coming in over the top of the waterproofing. I have, at this point taken the shoes on two, relatively short but difficult sub-alpine to alpine hikes. In both cases rain and water coming off vegetation made its way into the inside of the shoes. I had wet feet for miles. This was despite the use of gaiters and at one point waterproof pants. To figure how this was happening, when back home I used the sink and a tub of water.   At first, I suspected water was getting onto the tongue of the shoe then getting over the waterproof layer. i.e. going over the top of the waterproofing. This was NOT the case. Submerging the shoe in water but keeping the water from going onto the tongue resulted is a soaking wet shoe interior. I am not sure where the failure is but it is in BOTH shoes. Since these are "waterproof" shoes I would give them a 0 star review but they perform well, otherwise and I hope Mammut fixes the engineering or construction issue(s). (see pictures) If you are depending on keeping water out of your shoes these are a complete failure. Stay away.  

Second CON - the rubber at the toe (tip) of each shoes is already separating. Granted they were used on a terrifically challenging terrain with ultra hard and sharp rocks. With my pack they had about 230 lbs on them. I can try super glue but so early on in the life of a shoe this is a bummer. Given how vicious the rocks were, the slight separation of the rubber from the toe could be called a victory.  

PROS - Durability. Assuming the water issue is not due to wear,(some sort of hole punched by mother nature) they are holding up very well. The rocks these shoes had to deal with were super abrasive. I am impressed with how well the soles as well and the upper (sides) of the shoes resisted being torn to shreds. There is some wear on the side where rocks were grinding against them but there are no holes or tears. The waterproof membrane beneath, appears to be untouched. Great job. The sole took the abuse really well also. (see photos). 

PRO - The laces have incorporated some of the new lace engineering magic I am noticing in higher end shoes and they stay tied way better then laces of old. I'm not sure what engineering magic is going on here but keep it up.

SUBJECTIVE - Everyone's feet are different. But these are pretty comfortable and the fit is such at there is little to no relative movement of my foot in the shoe. I have room to splay out my toes at the same time. I have a relatively low volume foot. 

Looks - This is semi-subjective because my sense fashion is perfect. They look fairly decent. Thank you for not making your shoes look like they were colored with a highlighter.  I am a red-blooded American patriot and like my shoes to look the part of a rugged outdoorsman. Ding for feeling the need to have the brand plastered in giant letters on the side of the shoes. Not my style.  I am guessing they this this will sell shoes. How about putting the Mammoth icon instead. It looks cool and is still branding.
Another suggestion Mammut - goes with a medium grey (or medium tone neutral) over black. It just looks better and does not show dirt as much.

review.reviewBody: I like these gloves but the thumb is a little tight... I ended up sending them back because I like to wear liners and the liners were a little too tight in the thumb area for me.
review.name: Quality Gloves

review.reviewBody: Plenty warm enough for New Hampshire. Lining does not get clammy as others sometimes do, nor do they invert as some others do-Good for OR! Fit for rest of my hand is fine in length and diameter, but thumbs are too narrow, almost constricting.
review.name: Excellent but thumbs too narrow.

review.reviewBody: They're wonderful mittens. I've used them for snowboarding about five times now, and they've been life-changing. They keep me dry and warm, and they're very flexible and comfortable.
review.name: Dry, warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: First time owning mittens. The lack of dexterity takes some getting used to, but it's worth it for warm hands!
review.name: Cozy and warm

review.reviewBody: First use was mid 20° temps with light to moderate wind. Hands stayed dry (most important) and warm but not too warm. Went home with dry gloves that weren't soaked like a sponge.
review.name: Would recommend.

review.reviewBody: My only complaint with these mitts is they could be a little more durable. I primarily use them for snow removal work, which I'm sure is harder on them than skiing and snowboarding would be. That said, I really like these mitts- they stay super dry, they're very warm, and light weight. I love the pocket that you can throw a handwarmer in on very cold days- My hands have been comfortable in -20 degrees Fahrenheit in these babies with a handwarmer. I now have multiple pairs to share with snow removal crew if needed and for myself.
review.name: Great Mitts!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a new pair of gloves/mittens to go skiing. These are my first pair of mittens, and they work great! I love that they can stay attached to your wrist and are also easy to put on over your ski jacket. They are also warm.
review.name: Warm!!

review.reviewBody: I had similar gloves that I lost. I forget the name but they were 2 piece: fleece inner glove with a gortex outer shell. I'm so sad I lost them because I had to replace them with these. These are nice, warm gloves but I miss having the option of an insulated glove or just a shell over my hand. These have some features the others didn't like a zippered pocket for a hand warmer (but I still haven't figured our why anyone would want the handwarmer on the back of their hand?)
review.name: I miss the two piece gloves

review.reviewBody: Very warm, comfortable and love the colors. Very unique!
review.name: Solid Mitts!

review.reviewBody: Very impressed with how lightweight and non-bulky these mitts are for the warmth they deliver. I don't wear glove liners unless it's -15 or below or super windy. Just don't need them they are awesome. I love I can put my ski pass in the pocket on top of the glove.
review.name: Lightweight, not chunky yet SO WARM

name: Revolution GORE-TEX Mitten

review.reviewBody: Third  pair of logger socks I've had, but I am a long time Filson fan, and logger socks are a good example. I absolutely love the cushion and quality of these socks. Everyone has their own foot quirks, but for me: no better. They last about 2 years with hard use, have incredible cushion, perform like only wool can. I went with  large. I found the extra large size too big for my lower volume but still size 14 /48 foot, but size large was perfect. I use mine in everything:  ski, hiking, climbing, work boots. Love 'em. Love gifting them to my mountain fanatic sons.

review.reviewBody:
Bought for a backcountry gravel/bouldering bike tour in the Alps.  I normally wear lycra but wanted something a little tougher for resistance against brush and rock abrasion.  They served that purpose well.  The fabric has enough stretch that I what might feel kind of tight would actually be fine.  @ 5'11" / 160lb, size M was a little baggy at the waist but the addition of a belt resolved that problem.

 I wish the legs were an inch or two longer.   My expectation was they would cover my knees while pedaling but that is not the case; they tend to ride up to mid knee cap, exposing the skin to both scrapes and the cold.  The bungee cord leg cuff cinch straps are a nice touch but it is difficult to set them while wearing the trousers because the spring clamp is tucked inside a protective pocket.  That's a good thing because it protects against chaffing.

The pockets could be larger.  I use my phone for back-up maps and a large-screen device is that much more useful for this reason.  It is a very snug fit to get my large-ish phone into the leg pocket and to close the zipper.  The rear pockets need extra security like a zipper and/or velcro flap.  I took mine to a local seamstress/tailor to have flaps added.  Otherwise, I wouldn't even consider using the pockets.

So principally - deeper, protected pockets and longer legs and these would be perfect.
review.name: Just OK

review.reviewBody: Just got there Zoic knickers and at fort I wasn?t sure I?d like these....maybe outside my more traditional senses.  But these are great!!  I would rather ride with shorts but cool air on the legs and knees pretty much put a damper on this until May in Central Illinois.  I was getting of tired of the thermal full length riding pants on these coolish days and these knickers nailed it.  Highly recommend these. I bought Large. I?m 6?4? 168 lbs and generally wear 32x34 or 32x36 Levi?s jeans if that gives you perspective.  They are slightly loose in a Large but not too loose..but not wear they fall off.  So i would say the size gauge was accurate.
review.name: Zoic Knickers-Great fit great design

name: Reign Knickers - Men's

review.reviewBody:
I was looking for a WARM hooded jacket to wear under my fishing waters. After reading the reviews, I picked this one and sized up. 

While I haven’t gotten to use it yet, I’m impressed by the quality for the price: for example, every zipper has a pull!! 

I’m glad I sized up: on paper, I’d fit into a XS. I’m 5’2” and ~105lbs. But I have wide shoulders for my size, therefore long arms and a wider chest. So I got a Small.

The fit of the jacket isn’t slim nor is it “boxy.” It just runs small.
review.name: Great low-profile jacket - Size Up

review.reviewBody: I have only used this at temps around freezing (lower 30s) and along with a proper sleeping pad (pad reads an R 5 rating). It kept me warm and happy. It's roomy. Using one compression sack I could fit this in my 75 litters backpack. The zipper never get stuck. There's a flapper that seats nicely on ur neck and traps the heat inside the bag. The hat (or head part of the bag) can be adjusted to cover the head nicely. I haven't tested this around It's comfort temp but I'd definitely recommend this for temps around 30F.
review.name: Warm (at least around 30F)

name: Cosmic Sleeping Bag: 0F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: Great flat pedal shoe! I have flat, overpronated feet, so I only wear them on my bike and switch to a different shoe for walking. They are great for the purpose tho!
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody: These are very comfortable and have good traction for flat pedals.  They are low profile compared to some other MTB shoes and are comfortable for walking around in after biking.  I wear a 6.5 shoe and originally bought the 37, but had to exchange for the 38 which fits perfect.
review.name: Comfortable, light MTB shoes

review.reviewBody:
I was sooo excited to finally find a good looking flat pedal women's bike shoe in my size... or so I thought. I know sizing is always funky. In researching everyone said to go up a size. I usually wear a 36, 36.5 or 37 (Danskos, Ski boots, birks, running shoes).  So I ordered a 37... they're too big. There's a good 1/3 of an inch from the end of my toe to the tip of the shoe. Too big :(  so I will be returning and trying for a smaller size.  Unfortunately, Backcountry doesn't carry them in a 36, but the Pearl Izumi does!

The shoe is very attractive (for a mountain bike shoe), seems well built and comfortable if you can figure out the correct size!
review.name: Sizing Always an Issue

name: X-Alp Flow Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Grivel North Machine Carbon Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: North Machine Carbon Ice Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Grivel North Machine Carbon Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: North Machine Carbon Ice Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Grivel North Machine Carbon Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: North Machine Carbon Ice Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Grivel North Machine Carbon Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased these at the end of ice season after climbing on friends' Quantum Carbons. Compared to my 2nd gen Cobras the Grivel tools felt very light, yet seemed to get one-swing sticks most of the time. One of my reasons for wanting to move on from Cobras is that I didn't seem to be getting those one-swing placements with them. Also, I got tired of the subtle weight shift when I move up the shaft of the Cobras; except for blasted-in placements, moving from lower to upper position would cause the pick to rock. Usually the placement would hold, but spooky nonetheless.. The double-bend shafts of the North Machines are a good compromise between the security of 2-grip tools like Nomics (which I came to love on this last trip) and the clean lines of Cobras. The second position on the North Machines is just a nubbin at the bottom of the upper curve, but based on my experience with the Quantum Carbons it will be enough. Finally, I love the picks on the Quantums, and the North Machine picks look like more of the same hot-forged goodness.

Carbon shafts; tape will be required. Also, I will wrap the upper shafts, just below the heads, with old bike tube to protect the carbon shafts. I don't expect any of this to affect the swing or the overall lightness.

I've climbed on a succession of Black Diamond tools for more than 20 years. I still love the sleek lines of my Cobras. If I did more true alpine climbing I might appreciate the Cobras more. However, based on my recent experiences I'm ready to shake it up a bit. Looking forward to getting some ice time on the North Machines. Hoping with more use I can move this to 5 stars..

2020 addition: after the 2019/2020 ice season I can indeed move to 5 stars. These tools are remarkable - light and slim, yet the picks sink even in hard ice with just a flick of the wrist. I taped the shafts with hockey tape for grip, which helps a lot. A mate brought me one of the Ice Vario picks from the UK; these are significantly better (IMO) than the supplied picks, solid sticks from even the lowest energy swing. The tools don't shift when transferring from the pommel to the mid-shaft grip position. The tools are easy, confidence-inspiring, to climb on. Now to find a second Ice Vario pick, and get some ice this winter.
review.name: Amazingly light tools
comment: Thanks so much for posting this amazing review, we really appreciate it!

name: North Machine Carbon Ice Tool

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this jacket!! I am a petite adult and the size 14 fits me perfectly! I can still layer some sweaters underneath! Not only does it look great, it keeps me toasty warm. It’s also light and packable too! 5 stars!!
review.name: I LOVE this jacket!! I

review.reviewBody:
I bought this jacket for my 2. 5-year-old son, and it has been an absolute game-changer for Canadian winter weather. It's the first coat we've found that truly keeps him warm and dry during outdoor playtime at daycare, even on the chilliest, wettest days.

I was initially hesitant to purchase because the smallest size available was 4T, and my son typically wears 3T. He's quite skinny and stands about 35 inches tall, so I worried it might be too big. However, it fits him perfectly! There's enough room to grow, yet it doesn’t overwhelm him or hinder his movement. The jacket’s design and quality really shine through—it's soft, flexible, and not stiff at all. He can run, play, and bend down with ease, and it never topples him over or feels bulky.

The fact that he loves wearing it is the biggest win for me. Getting him dressed for cold weather used to be a struggle, but now he’s eager to put it on. The color is exactly as pictured, which was a pleasant surprise, and the removable hood is such a practical feature.

If you’re on the fence about sizing up or worried about mobility, don’t be. This jacket checks every box for functionality, comfort, and style. Highly recommend!
review.name: Perfect Winter Jacket for Active Toddlers: Warm, Flexible, and True to Quality!

review.reviewBody: What a great jacket. My little guy is toasty warm, and the hood is a great size. It completely covers his ears and extends forward the right amount - sometimes I find hoods too short. This is a great jacket. Well definitely keep repurchasing.
review.name: First timer- hooked

review.reviewBody: I had such a hard time getting him in a coat before this, but my almost-4 year old is in love with this jacket. thank you!
review.name: He loves it

review.reviewBody: Super warm and cozy and looks well made. The 4 year old likes it.
review.name: Super warm and cozy and

description: Buy the Backcountry Carbon Splitboarding Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carbon Splitboarding Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Carbon Splitboarding Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The push buttons don’t lock consistently. The problem predominantly occurs in snow/cold. Very frustrating. I used these for 3 seasons pretty heavily and would just hold them on the ride down to avoid the issue , which defeats the benefit of collapsing poles.

I snapped one in half on a recent trip on the ride out on some flat terrain. I formed some opinions, lever locks and aluminum from here on out.
review.name: Light and unreliable

review.reviewBody:
Ugh. I've never hated a piece of equipment more than these poles. 

The push button locks refuse to work as soon as these poles see any bit of snow on them, resulting in poles that disconnect constantly. And then it's impossible to pull them apart when you actually need to. 

I've used 4 different poles and they all have the same exact issues.

Completely worthless design and guaranteed to frustrate you all day long.
review.name: Worthless and frustrating

review.reviewBody: I've only got a couple of tours with these, but here is my take.  All quite good except the fold.  Grips good, adjustment good, weight good for the price, deployment good, handle good for risers.  I'm happy with them, but the trifold isn't very useful with the baskets on.  They fold up super tight if you remove the baskets, but I'm not going to be removing/reinstalling baskets in the field.  I sort of wish I had gotten the ski-specific poles, as they are a little lighter/cheaper and I'm strapping on the outside of the pack anyway.  I suppose if you're traveling with these, they'd be great for packing, but I'd recommend the ski poles over these even for splitboarders.
review.name: all good except the fold

review.reviewBody: ...lightweight carbon, foldable, adjustable length, long grips, powder baskets, BUT, they're not durable. I used them at most 5x since I got them in March, and yes, one broke, when I tapped it against my boot yesterday. I never stepped on them, or scraped them. Seems random. Very disappointing for a product with great specs. Even though they are light, the swing weight seems high, maybe that puts extra stress on the bottom of the pole? My single pole will now go in my avy pack as a spare to be used only in case of emergency.
review.name: Like everything about these poles...

review.reviewBody:
Ive used these for almost 250 days these past 2 winters, they are great poles. Cant go wrong, lightweight and easy to fold.

Id say the only downside is the basket size is a tad bit too small, but thats for days where it snows at least 2 feet overnight. Beyond that they're great and haven't had any issues with them
review.name: Trusty poles

name: Carbon Splitboarding Poles

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have been using Granite Gear cordura compression sacks for many years but took a chance on the Sea To Summit compression sacks. To my surprise, they were not only equally rugged enough to meet the rigor of my motorcycle travel, they were also lighter and more water resistant. Quality product for sure!
review.name: Tough Enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] When I first bought it, I thought there was no way my massive sleeping bag could fit inside. I was wrong. Stuffs perfectly in and fast, too. Feels durable and I’ve had no complaints so far. It also compresses down smaller than other similar sacks I’ve tried. 10/10!
review.name: Deceptively amazing.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have several sizes of these and use them all. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great sack

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I use it for a 10 deg hammock under quilt as mine only came with a stuff sack. Works well and is lightweight making it easier to keep things in my bag organized and where I want them in my bag. I've only used it 3 times so far but i don't see any issues of wear and tear for many years as i don't usually beat up a compression sack. I don't store my quilt in it when it's not being used, I just hang it on the hanger with the quilt.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This isn't my first Sea to Summit compression sack. They are durable and well-made and just don't seem to tear or fail. You can really pack a sleeping bag into it. And even though it's not water proof, it does seem to repel water.
review.name: Durable and really compresses

review.reviewBody: This compression bag was going to be for my hammock down under quilt but I was hoping this bag was going to be a little stronger but I'm very weary of the compression straps, it's going to fail me at the wrong time and at that time it's going to be called a fancy trash bag. I would do a return on it but a week out on that is not worth it.
review.name: My little bunny

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worked wonders for compressing my clothes in my “personal item” carry on. Fit everything I really needed for a 6 day lake stay (granted it’s summer clothes and bathing suits which take up less space). Looking forward to using it this winter when doing some hut trips, too. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Helpful for “Personal Item” Compression

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect! It was exactly what I was looking for to get my 0* down quilt down to a packable size! Get's the job done and keeps the water out when inside my pack!
review.name: Perfect! It was exactly what

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This dress is much too small in the chest and the waist is too high for the design.
review.name: Poor design in the upper body

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've worn this dress fly fishing, to a work event, and out to dinner with nice earrings and wedges. How many dresses can you say that about? So comfortable. So classic. So easy!
review.name: Buying a second.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am 5'5", 135lb., 34C and purchased this in a medium. I am normally a size 6 in most brands. Unfortunately, this ended up being an empire-waisted dress which is not at all what I wanted or is even comfortable. I don't know if that's too much bust for the dress or I'm too long-waisted, or a combination of both, but the end result is the same.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautifully styled dress! The fitting is wonderful, I'd suggest sizing one size down if you like a more fitted look, if you like a more casual look go with your regular size!! 10/10

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice lightweight dress. It fits a big snug but not enough to size up. It will be a go to for me this summer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Durable, quick drying, and versatile! I love this dress and I want it in every color. I like the conservative cut so it can be worn to work. More colors please! (Note: it does run a little small. Usually I'm a Medium in North Face. I bought a large and it fits perfectly!)
review.name: Great summer staple

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This dress is so comfy and it's a very modest. It actually hits me about 1 inch above my knee I am 5'5, 100 pounds. Long enough for modesty.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this dress so so much!!!!
review.name: Loved it so much I bought three

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can wear this golfing or with cute sandals to dress it up!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect dress and amazing for travel. Wash and dry without shrinking or wrinkleS. Being 5'2" I had them hemmed. Thank you north face for making a cute and extremely comfortable dress that fits someone petite!! (5'2" 107# for reference). Can be dressed up with jewelry or worn completely casual. Purchased in 2 colors and would buy more if more colors were offered.

review.itemreviewed: Merino 10 Ultra Light Mini Crew Sock
review.reviewBody: These socks are gold! I have bought many feeture socks before but these are truly amazing. Light, can’t feel them, supportive, they maintain their shape, my feet have zero damp or wet feel and they are so well made and the fiber combination is just so precise that I can wear them multiple times without having to wash them bc there is zerooooooooooooooo odor!!!!! I can’t believe it. I don’t have stinky feet to begin with but I figured alright it’s been 4 times some odor should have developed but no!!!!! I’m buying 20 more pairs of these.

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Ugh…runs ridiculously small. I have 3 other Adrenalines and 7.5 is perfect. I received these for Christmas, super excited about the color and Gore Tex. But they run so small, my toe is at the very end, even with no socks. I double checked inside the shoe to make sure they weren’t in the wrong box.  I have plenty of room in my others that are 7.5. And I also have worn the Ariel for years, always a 7.5. Yes, I know they are returnable but, Brooks, you need to be consistent. Returns are a pain and they don’t seem to be available in any stores near me. I am not even sure an 8 will do. Disappointed.
review.name: Runs very small.

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Gore Tex is great and keeps the feet dry. However the soles when wet are dangerously slippery on ceramic, travertine, floors or smooth surfaces, especially like those in public buildings such as  the Y or commercial offices lobbies.Too much plastic? Stick to rubber soles.  Not good. Stop skimping on the quality.
review.name: Slippery soles when wet.

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I wanted to love these! After loyally running and walking in several pairs of Adrenalines for many years now, I was thrilled to see a waterproof / winter-happy model emerge. However, when my usual size (9) arrived, it was significantly smaller - everywhere - than the regular version. I have since returned them and ordered a 1/2 size up. Hope that works!
review.name: Runs much smaller than the regular Adrenaline

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Love these shoes. I'm so grateful to have found a jogging/working out/living shoe for the winter that keeps my toes warm and dry. I went up half a size like the other reviews suggested and they fit great. 

What I love most about these and my other Adrenalines is how long the soles last. I wear these ten to twelve miles a day most days of the week and it was a solid ten months before my first pair wore down. My Nike's never last more than three months and even my Hoka's are toast after four or five months. The staying power of these alone makes them worth it. 

My one suggestion? The winter is drab enough - let's hit these with the neon stick! I want some bright green/yellow/orange/aqua for the grey days - all the way from the soles to the laces.
review.name: My toes are stay warm and dry this winter!

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Thanks for the helpful reviews, to help with purchase. They do come up tight, would have gone half size bigger. They are slippy but overall very pleased, thankyou, worn in fast.
review.name: Adrnal8ne GTS 23

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I'm 75 and started with plantar faciitis. Have had problem before and bought these a few years ago. Bought these and immediate relief.
review.name: Not just for running

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really like how these are waterproof, but they are not comfortable at all. The sole could use a lot more cushion.
review.name: Waterproof but not comfy

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately the heel collar was too low so didn’t hold my foot correctly. I had to send them back.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I am heartbroken.  Was so excited to see my go to road shoe of the last 5 years in a British weather appropriate GTX version.  I ordered the same size as I always had in the past, half a size larger than my usual size, laced them up on a rainy November evening and set off.  I managed a hilly 10k, by the end every downhill stride my toes smashed up against the end of toe box, I was in agony and don't think I can wear again.  Thank heavens I didn't debut them in a 10 mile road race the week before in the pouring rain. Gorgeous looking Brooks design, great Gore Tex waterproofing but I'd advise to order up a full size up.
review.name: Size up!

review.itemreviewed: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Too small. I think it’s the waterproofing that makes them smaller than other Brooks.

name: Adrenaline GTS 23 GTX Running Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Union Rover Approach Ski - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rover Approach Ski - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Union Rover Approach Ski - 2025 online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I have used these many times in comparison to my Drift boards. I like the Drift system better. First, assuming you already have a snowboard setup, it's much cheaper to get the Drifts that come with their own binding. With Rovers, you have to buy a split board binding to go with the Rover. Second, Drift boards transition much faster if you use their binding and just leave your binding on your snowboard. Moving your split binding from board to board takes away a lot of the convenience and doesn't really work if you're pow surfing because you'd have to carry those bindings back down the hill. 

Lastly there are a few little things; the Rovers are heavier and softer, they have a long section in the back that doesn't have any skin on it and doesn't serve any purpose, and they have a mini sidecut that actually wants to turn the ski when you're gliding in the skin track. It's sort of annoying. So as noted, they work, but I think Drift is a little more dialed system.
review.name: They work but not as well as Drifts

name: Rover Approach Ski - 2025

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love all my NEMO equipment and was excited to see that my new bag is both made from recycled materials and is recyclable, so it won't end up in a landfill.  The value of the quality product combined with the sustainability and amazing warranty make this bag a no brainer.  Since I am close to the size limit of the regular bag, I sized up for more room.
review.name: Love brands that take responsibility

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was so excited when I read the reviews and description of this sleeping bag. I am a side sleeper and have found my other mummy bags restricting and hard to sleep on my side. I was so comfortable and impressed with this bag. It kept me extra warm. I liked having a stuff bag to pack the sleeping bag into as well as a storage bag when left at home. I’d highly recommend this sleeping bag!
review.name: Fabulous bag for side sleepers.

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a sleeping bag that would keep me warm in upper 30/lower 40 degree weather, wasn't as constricting as a mummy bag, and had a zipper that wouldn't get stuck when I was trying to get out of it. The Nemo Forte definitely checked all of those boxes. I used it on my last camping trip and had the best night of sleep I've ever had camping. The separate storage mesh and compression bags are also nice to have. I had some trouble stuffing into the compression bag but my husband had no trouble at all. I definitely recommend this bag and the male Forte bag.
review.name: Great upgrade from my previous bag.

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: Im SUPER pleased with mine! Soft, squishy, and WARM!!
review.name: Snug as a bug!!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got this sleeping bag to replace my old summer bag.  I wanted to make sure that I had one that could withstand some cooler nights in WI (usually not THAT cold, but my old 40 degree bag from another company didn't suffice any longer).  I've used it a few times already now and it is great!  The vents are nice since they can be opened when it is warmer, and closed when it is cooler (and one evening I was getting a bit cold and zipping them up worked)!  I definitely like this as a summer bag where I am. A hot night I would need to have it upzipped, but it is light enough to work!
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: I had been looking for a new sleeping bag that would give me a bit more warmth for less weight. I did the research for months but I couldn't find anything that was a reasonable price and not a super tight mummy bag that had the features I wanted... until I found this! Enough room to sleep on your side and spread out a bit and the features of the flap and hood left me warm and cozy! My only complaint is that the zippers on the vents are a little thin for my preference, they got stuck a few times when trying to zip them no matter how careful I was. It makes me hesitant to use that feature.
review.name: So Comfy!

review.itemreviewed: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have taken this bag on two trips now and love it. I am a side sleeper and this bag is perfect for that.
review.name: Great for side sleeping

name: Forte Endless Promise Sleeping Bag: 35 Deg - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Brooks Ghost 15 GTX Running Shoe - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shape, I love the goretex option. Good for walking around the city. The laces have come undone twice already, though.
review.name: Pretty good shoe

review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable runners I've ever had. I only walk (no running) but I have an arthritic toe and the cushioning together with the curved front of the shoe meant I had no pain after walking all winter.
review.name: Very comfy.

review.reviewBody: This is a good, durable shoe, it doesn’t have the amount of energy return that I like to have
review.name: Good , durable shoe. Not as much energy return as I like.

review.reviewBody: Great running shoe which is both visually appealing and amazingly functional. The special design of the sole propels you forward while the heel keeps you firmly grounded and stable. The Gore-Tex lining is highly recommended as it keeps the morning dew out of your shoe as you move through grass. And all delivered at a great price point. This is a serious running shoe wrapped in an attractive, tasteful look.
review.name: Looks and function at an amazing price

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great shoe's  comfortable keeps your feet dry great arch support
review.name: Great shoes

review.reviewBody: Fit is slightly smaller than Ghost 15; better for cold, wet weather keeping your feet drier. More durable, too.
review.name: Drier and durable

review.reviewBody: I’ve had 5 pairs of these and in all weather are just the best. Each pair I get around 1200km
review.name: Ghost who walks !

review.reviewBody: I usually need to wear support insole for my sore feet but there are not needed with Brooks shoes
review.name: Help sore feet

review.reviewBody: Great shoe. Allows me to walk with improvements in my overall walking.  I walk 9 miles, 6 days a week without issue to the muscles in my legs.  Wonderful improvement over my previous shoes. Will continue to purchase Ghost for my future shoe.
review.name: Great Walking Shoe - Ghost 15 GTX

review.reviewBody: Bought these because I wanted something breathable but waterproof. I typically wear adrenaline which are more comfortable to me. The need for waterproof drove me to buy these and I have not been disappointed. While I would love an adrenaline gtx, these have impressed me with how dry they keep my feet in a light rain or while spraying things down with a hose outside. Would highly recommend.
review.name: Great waterproof shoe.

name: Ghost 15 GTX Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Unable to find an 11 wide in woman's, I followed Keens sizing chart and bought a 9. 5 mens wide. Perfect fit. 
So the chart was helpful and accurate.

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love your foot wear! It’s not about having TRENDY shoes for me anymore. They’re functional, well made and most importantly…
COMFORTABLE. I do appreciate your product.
review.name: I love your foot wear!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: It’s hard for me to find wide comfortable shoes. This pair of Keens I bought have a wide toe box and I love the way they fit. Unfortunately, after just a few months, the sole is coming off the shoe around the toe area. I wear them all the time, but less than three months is a little soon for me.
review.name: Love my Keens, but….

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have wide flat feet that I made worse by wearing minimalist shoes. The Targhee IIIs fit reasonably well with the orthotics I have to wear now and are getting more comfortable as they break in.
review.name: A little narrow for orthotics.

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: My husband opened the package 2 weeks ago for his birthday. He has not taken the shoes off except to sleep at night. He absolutely loves them! He has a pair of Keen hiking boots so I thought I would try the lower shoe. Can't go wrong with Keen. Super comfortable.
review.name: Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are complete garbage. They are environmentally friendly and end user worthless. Soles feel apart literally within 4 days of ownership. Stay using materials that keep the soles together. Used to live KEEN. Will NOT buy another pair.
review.name: Sole glue is not good

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Waterproof Leather Wide Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are comfortable shoes; and with tough soles for rough terrain.
review.name: Hiking shoes

review.reviewBody: I bought this swimsuit for a beach/surf trip and it has become my new favorite. It is very flattering, the color is vibrant, and - most importantly - it stays in place while surfing and getting tossed/playing in the waves. The suit is sturdy and feels high quality. review.reviewBody: Son muy hermosas, quedan espectacular con cualquier cosa. Lindas y cómodas el color es precioso, la suela es muy cómoda te ajusta super bien.
review.name: Lindas y cómodas

review.reviewBody: These are great boots! I was a little nervous about the fit, given that I have bigger calves, but the stretchy backs of the boot allowed for a comfortable, snug fit. I’ve worn them with leggings, tights, and with skinny jeans tucked into the boot and they have fit well over all! They’re also warm and comfortable pretty much right out of the box.
review.name: Good for bigger calves!

review.reviewBody: These boots were so attractive I wanted to love them. However the material around the ankle on one boot weirdly bent inward into my ankle causing it to rub. The company policy is that the boot has to be returned unworn so I didn’t take a chance on wearing them, hoping it would break in and go away. I just retuned them to be safe. The sizing was good I range between a 6.5-7 and I purchased a 7 to wear with warm socks and it fit my foot perfectly. I’m sad they don’t offer a 15-30 day comfort guarantee on their shoes. I would have loved to give this boot a chance to break in. The footbed felt comfy too.
review.name: Cute but not functional for me
comment: We strive to deliver great product and service, so we’re sorry to hear you were disappointed. If you are willing to share more feedback on how we can help, please email info@ariat.com so that we can better assist you.

review.reviewBody: So I received my boot in dark brown and they do fit perfect!  So perfect that I may not wear thick socks 😁  which is fine.  I am normally a 6.5 wide but ordered a 7 in this boot.  I like the shape, the lil heel and the fact that it's waterproof.  Will be a plus come our Montana winter when I wear em for work.
review.name: Great stylr

review.reviewBody: I have a difficult time finding comfortable shoes  and get a lot of foot pain and the Sutton boots really surprised me.  I wore them for the entire day the first time I wore them and they were incredibly comfortable.  I just loved them!
review.name: Great fit and so comfortable

review.reviewBody: I ordered these for my granddaughter and she LOVED them!!!Perfect size Perfect fit!
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Love these boots, the only high boots that fit my thick calves comfortably bc they’re very stretchy & they’re really good quality! Have had them for years & buying more when they're back in stock for sure

Worn twice and I have to say, this boot is very comfortable and breaking in has been easy. I liked them enough to purchase the brown pair, which should arrive tomorrow. A little discomfort around the heel and ankle, but it may have been related to the socks I wore and the unexpected amount of walking I did.
review.name: Great Waterproof Boots

review.reviewBody: Very nice boot, seems well made and high quality. I'm happy with the style and price. I have wide feet and fell they're a little narrow, but since they are leather, they will stretch out. I am a 9.5-10 in sneakers and sandals, but a size 9 fit me best in these boots. They are snug, not loose, around the calf, which I liked. I hope these will only get more beautiful through the years.
review.name: Cute boot, nice fit

review.reviewBody: Boots are tight to get on and off when you first get them. You do need to stretch them for a few nights and wear them. Calf is tight but once again require stretching period. Have not had opportunity to wear them in wet weather.
review.name: Allow time to stretch

name: Sutton II H2O Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Mini Drive 400 Headlight online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The light has good lumens but the higher one lasts about an hour.  The strap is incredible small, I had to pull it hard to make it go around my handlebar which is an standard sized road bar and it fitted on the very last hole; dunno what can go through the other 4 holes, it's way too short for it to strap in a non-akward way somewhere else or even to not scratch whatever you are going around with it.

It has a lot of different patterns to choose but the most useful are the first 3 settings and maybe the strobbing for day is useful too.  Be aware that it doesn't use cables to charge because it has it's own "stick" protuding on the back part, protected by a hard gum while not charging; you have to find an usb port with space to spare around, since the strap will get on the way while charging it.
review.name: good little lamp for the price

name: Mini Drive 400 Headlight

Hopefully they will stay on better after a little wearing in.

comment: Hello Blondie626, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's Ella™ II Puff Slide Sandal is hard to size. We’re happy to help rectify the issue if you will reach out to our support team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Obsessed. Got them in this color and the white/teal combo. I’m usually a 9.5 with a narrow foot and the 9 fit perfectly. They go with everything and super comfortable. I wear them at work on my feet for 8+ hours a day and from day one never had a problem.
review.name: Obsessed.

review.reviewBody: Love this shoe, very comfortable to wear all day long
review.name: Slide Sandal

review.reviewBody:
Regret this purchase. They look so cute, but they are narrow. Therefore my foot slips back, and hangs off the edge. I have several pairs of Sorel shoes and boots, including a heavy duty winter boot. But this sandal as well as a pair of slippers I bought both run narrow! So neither works and neither were cheap. I have worn a few times hoping they would break in and stretch but there has been no stretch. Feet slipping back in slides is not cute (or comfortable). I have an older pair of mules that I practically lived in and only wore indoors to keep they nicer for longer - so I didn't expect these to be too tight/ narrow. I will wear them to take the dog outside to see if they will give in, but fall is approaching so I'll
Probably won't wear much and they'll just be a shoe that sits in my closet. Not good for the full price. I have an old pair of Nik--- that I pulled out to wear instead.
review.name: Too Narrow
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: I normally wear a size 7 or 7.5 but had to buy a size 8 to fit these. They are comfy when I am not moving, but as soon as I start walking they push my foot out of the shoe. The padding on the straps just seems to push my foot out and I end up walking on half the shoe or having to kick my toe back in every 100 feet. They are cute, but I got these as a practical everyday wear slip on and they really aren't going to work for that.
review.name: Straps push my foot out
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our support team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody: Nice neutral sandal, very comfortable, but wish it had a little more arch & heel support
review.name: Simple comfort

review.reviewBody: I just got them ! They are true to size really comfortable amazing  minimal style I am size 10.  I definitely recommend them !!!! And the delivery right on time without any issues!
They are cute but a little stiff. I hope they break in soon.
review.name: Cute but stiff
comment: Hello Yadi, we want to extend our sincerest apologies concerning this issue. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.
