review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes as a gift. He could not get his foot into the tiny hole (size 11) My daughter, who wears a ladies 9 also tried and could not get her foot in. I will be sending them back today.
review.name: Shoe opening too small for foot
comment: We appreciate your feedback. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: There is no tongue so the laces serve no purpose. I found the fit was perfect for my size 9 but too difficult to get on my feet every day.  I have other Merrell shoes without laces that I get on easily with or without a shoe horn.
review.name: Hard to get on

review.reviewBody: could not get my foot into the tiny elastic foothole
review.name: no
comment: We're sorry to hear these didn't work for you. If we can help please give us a call at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com.

review.reviewBody: Amazing shoes… I was an old school Alpine lover and these are WAY better. They are more comfortable, more stable and have a better overall look. Great work on the new Alpines.
review.name: Love the new 83’s!!!

review.reviewBody: I've had my Alpine 83 for 2 weeks and love them. Very comfortable. I wear insoles in most shoes for extra comfort, not needed with these. Holiday sale pricing was so good, I already ordered another pair in another color. Run a half size small in my opinion. I normally wear size 8 in most shoes, but I wear 8.5 in Merrell.
review.name: Great shoe, super comfortable

review.reviewBody:
Horrible. Merrill destroyed a great shoe. 

We used to also buy Merrill’s for all our kids, and have noticed a significant difference. Merrill used to mean quality, but that has clearly changed. Merrill’s are now cheaply made and are low quality. It seems they sacrificed proper materials at the alter of sustainability to say they use recycled materials. 

We have stopped buying Merrill’s and no longer refit them to friends and neighbors.
review.name: Faltering quality

review.reviewBody: With no “tongue” in this shoe, it is really, really hard to put them on. I would not order this style again.
review.name: What… no tongue?

review.reviewBody: Shoes were super comfortable right out of the box with great arch support, which is a high priority for me. I wore them around town, on paved city trails and on rough terrain hikes. I was on the front range of the Rockies! I have since ordered another pair!
review.name: Super comfortable while in the Rockies!!

review.reviewBody:
Absolutely hate this new “recraft.” The original alpines were classics for a reason. My husband and I usually buy a matching pair of Alpines every year, often twice. It’s something we look forward to and wearing together. They had a retro feel and were a classically comfortable everyday shoe. The built was perfect and we always received compliments. 

We ordered our holiday pair of new 83 Recrafts and we really couldn’t believe how cheaply and poorly they were made. Merrell turned a great, well built classic with good materials made it into a stiff, poorly constructed slipper shoe with cheap materials, sloppy construction, a plastic-ky sole, and increased the price. The 83 Recraft is a money-grab and disappointment to customers, and we’re sending our pairs back. Seeing Merrell’s quality and construction decline in other shoes, as well. Sad to see.
review.name: An extreme disappointment

review.reviewBody: Great shoes! Comfortable and stylish. I got the black with leather trim in the heel. Really an excellent shoes so far. I wear them to work in a large carpeted office but these would do well anywhere. Flecked laces and Lacing system are cool too!
review.name: Upscale sneakers for office and trail

name: Alpine 83 Recraft Sneaker - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is the perfect size to make a meal for a group of 4-8 people. When used on top of a Jetboil Genesis Basecamp stove it heats up quick and the flux ring helps keep the wind out. Might get a second one since you can fit two of them side by side on the stove.

review.reviewBody: Great for camping with a family.  Big enough to warm up soup or stew for 6 people.  Fast, efficient, light.  Going to get rid of my Prius stove and camp cookware in favor of the big jet boil pots and stove.

review.reviewBody: I was disappointed how thin the fabric was . Doesn’t feel like there is any filling , just flat nylon fabric
review.name: Thin

review.reviewBody: Purchasing 2 more of these as I love them, however I was dismayed to find that the sizing of the 2 new shirts are larger than my previous ones and I will have to have them taken in! I’m still happy with the colour, but they fit more like a size small than extra small and are about an inch wider than my older 2 skirts!
review.name: Love - but the sizing has changed?

review.reviewBody: Fit is really big. the back part is sort of strange and ducky. did not fit my body type (slim and not curvy) but I could see it fit tinga different body type really well and be flattering & warm.
review.name: Strange design. May work for some

review.reviewBody: Reading the reviews I was nervous about trying this skirt. I even quickly said "no way" once I tried it on. But I compared it to the more close-to-the-body skirts and in a few days/a few more try ons I realized it was more social than fitness oriented in it's cut, but was cute and chill in it's own way. The waist being more like a yoga-pants material instead of relying on side-only stretch like most skirts is super comfy if your ski includes a snack/sit hang before and after. I probably would have sized down from medium to small if I'd tried in-store. Really didn't want the waist to be tight. Fits with the general oversize/relaxed cut trends for snow gear in 2024. Skirt keeps core cozy but leaves lots of room to shed heat through the thighs during a 5k ski.
review.name: Funny shape but relaxed and comfy.

review.reviewBody: Note, it's a pull on skirt! There's no zipper. It does have stretch fabric at the top and a bit on the sides of your hips. So if you've got hips like me, size up. I'm between the sizes of S-M, and initially ordered the small based on reviews and the A line fit. Yet, couldn't easily get her over my hips so sized up. The M is loose around my waist now, but I'm going to be wearing this over layers and a sweater/jacket will hid any looseness in the waist. It's a thinner/lighter insulated skirt compared to the backcountry one.
review.name: Cute winter skirt

review.reviewBody: This skirt is made of nice fabric and is good weight but the shape/design is off.  I think it might work for someone who has large hips.  I have hips, but not super wide. The skirt flairs out in a wider than A-line shape and for me at least there too much fabric around the hips.
review.name: Hip-py skirt, for the larger hip woman!

review.reviewBody: I bought this in a whim thinking I was pushing it in the “practicality” department, but I am super happy I bought this skirt. Wore it a few times this winter over leggings in inclement weather. Best useage was on a day hike with a ton of vertical and super windy and variable temps—everything from pleasant to crossing snow pack. It was 110% perfect for that excursion. Can’t wait for it to get cold again so I can use this item. Love it.
review.name: Perfect for variable cool conditions.

review.reviewBody: Very cute cute thermal skirt for winter weather.  I would have worn this throughout the winter season however the design has a funny drop in the back at the pleat.  It sticks out a bit and looks a little like a duck tail.  I tried to get used to the look trying it on several times however it was too “ducky”.
review.name: Cute skirt, bit of an odd design

review.reviewBody: Love the color but the fit is a bit of for me. I have a thick middle and thin hips, the elastic around the waist is not very stretchy, so it is a bit snug, the hips fit great. The teal color is beautiful and it is a cute skrt.
review.name: Great color not enough stretch in waist.

review.reviewBody: Looks cute off, has great features & love the color. Just an odd fit. Bought a small. I’m 5’4-1/2” & 127 lb, 59-y-o ultra runner. I’m usually a small, but athletic & square, so occasionally things are more snug in the waist than the hips. However, the more snug waist was disproportionate to the funky flair in the hips. It was just odd. I have a skirt in another brand I love, but I wanted a second. Maybe should’ve exchanged for the other MH skirt, but didn’t want to go to the trouble.
review.name: Wanted to love it; returned

name: Trekkin Insulated Mini Skirt - Women's

review.itemreviewed: React Pegasus Trail 4 GORE-TEX Running Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Nike Pegasus Trail 4 Gore-Tex - underwhelming, a downgrade, nothing special! Make sure you get these sneakers on some kind of a discount. 

Pegasus Trail 3s Gore-Tex were better designed and made! And now the (Nike Zegama Men's Trail Running Shoes) looks like what the Pegasus Trail 3’s were, how confusing. The Pegasus Trail 4 Gore-Tex are ultra-lightweight sneakers with NOT enough protection for what they we’re and are supposed to be. Barely any all-important arch support :( wish these sneakers had OrthoLite Open-Cell Foam Insoles! No toe-tip protection. Only 6 lace-lets, needs a centered 7th on the vampm an a lace through tongue. Needs 1 to 2 mm more heel-height. Very oddly rounded sloppy toe-box and toe-cap. Also their is exposed midsole foam on the outer-soles. These are NOT supposed to be ultra-lightweight outdoor trail running sneakers. Nike Footwear Designers please leave that for other models such as the Pegasus 36 Gore-Tex. I’m looking for great design, build quality, durability, performance fitment, support, stability, style, waterproofing, and grippy traction.

Why does Nike’s Trail Running Sneakers have these wider toe-boxes and rounded toe-caps which does NOT ergonomically contour the front of the asymmetrical human foot properly? To sloppy!
 
They’re fine for every-day wear, but I don’t feel they offer enough support, stability, or durability for any kind of real active athletic endeavors. 

Pros are that they are Gore-Tex with a slight gator and pull-tabs, and they are very breathable because of the thin Gore-Tex membrane. *And they finally came out in an all Blacked-Out color-way, but the all-Black color-way was only offered on nike.com and in Nike stores, hard to obtain.

Pegasus Trail 4 Gore-Tex are actually lighter than the lower profiled Pegasus 36 Gore-Tex which are ultra-lightweight, which is NOT what I want or need. But the one thing I like about the Pegasus 36 Gore-Tex is it has a more asymmetrical ergonomic pointed toe-box and toe-cap.

The Air Max 2015 was the best shaped and fitting sneaker Nike has ever designed and produced. Nike Designers please stick with the Air Max 2015’s awesome Last!!!

Height: Low
Height of the Upper: Low Gator
Waterproof: Gore-Tex
Foot Protection: Basic :(
Foot Support: Neutral
Cushioning: Moderate
Insoles: Average :( 
Arch Support: Low :( 
Shoe Width: Medium to Wide
Toe-Box: Wide :(
Toe-Cap: Rounded :(
Drop: 10 mm, needs 1+ mm more in Heel Height!
Fitment: True to Size in length, BUT wide in the Toe-Box. 

I'll be switching to the Nike’s Zegama Gore-Tex version in all-Black whenever they are released.
review.name: Underwhelming, nothing special!

name: React Pegasus Trail 4 GORE-TEX Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Best weekend warrior tires. A lot of grip and really does resist a lot of puncture.
review.name: The only tires I use

review.reviewBody: I really wanted these tires to become my go-to tires but after running through two sets, I'm done.  They roll great and they're light but I've experienced 3 punctures that didn't seal on their own and leaked even after repairing from the inside with multiple methods. I ride mostly roads and bike paths and go out of my way to dodge glass and road debris.  After they no longer hold air set up tubeless they basically become a really expensive tubed tire that no longer has the rolling resistance or weight benefits you pay for.  No thanks.
review.name: Real fast, tough as a latex balloon

review.reviewBody: honestly for me the best tires
review.name: Best Tires!!!

review.reviewBody: After trying many other tires over the years these are my favs for my weekly trail workouts...typically I can keep these at a average of 17mph average speeds on a semi rough paved trail in Sacramento CA area on 2020 trek domane slr7 etap for around 20 miles with a good amount of effort...others I have tried are great tires but these seem to be the best balance of weight, comfort(32cm at sram calc psi tubless muc off... sealant 190 rider), and reliablity...you can probably find something a little faster but it will probably be a race day tire that will sacrafice relialbility etc...for years I road gatorskin hardshells to ride to work and they seem to be really tough but you will sacrafice weight, harshness, and resistance for probably about the ultimate durability
review.name: Great fast workout joy ride tires

review.reviewBody: These tires are very fast and I haven't had a puncture yet. But they are very tough to mount as tubeless. They are extremely tight on the wheel and tend to draw into the center of the wheel groove and away from the rim. So unless you have a way to inflate them quickly with a high-flow rate air line like a bike shop, you may have trouble getting them to expand out to the rim and create a seal when mounting tubeless. I eventually gave up and put Continental Conti-Tubes in them since that's what I'm more familiar with. They are excellent tires now.
review.name: Fast tires but tough to mount tubeless.

review.reviewBody: I have been running Conti 5000 GPs for over 5 years. I find them to be durable, fast, and extremely comfortable. I have run both 25mm and 28mm. I am going to give the 30mm a try on my next set.
review.name: Continental GP 5000 have never let me do

review.reviewBody: This has been my go to TR tires since continental offered TR ready tires
review.name: Conti TR 5000

review.reviewBody: They roll quick and were way easier to set up than regular Conti gp's
review.name: Easier to mount

review.reviewBody:
Easy to get on and off, can always pump it up with just a regular hand pump, no drama! 

Fast tire and rides really well. Love the traction cornering. I get at least 2,000 mi from a tire.

I use orange seal, never have a puncture flat, over 20,000 miles flat-free on Continental tires and Orange Seal.
review.name: Great tire!

review.reviewBody: I have struggled with mounting and dismounting TR tires for years. These are a dream to work with!
review.name: The easiest mounting tubeless tire I hav

review.reviewBody: The clogs fit fine. But the heel strap in the "sport mode" needs a design improvement. If the clog needs to be more snug and the side straps are cinched in to make them shorter, the tab ends, are loose flap around. But because the tab ends are thick plastic, I can't employ a few stitches to tag them to the strap. Moving them to the top of the clog is dangerous at our house. We have a steep set of stairs with a protruding nose that hangs out over the riser. The straps snag on each step. The straps can't be removed without cutting the plastic strap guide. That would would still leave the plastic part that attached to the shoe. That will not only look weird it could also snag on any number of things. These look good, but need help in the strap design department.
review.name: Design flaw for not just my foot but also my safety!

review.reviewBody: Was looking for a Croc to use during the winter when sidewalks were covered with ice and snow, and the All-Terrian Lined Clog does the job extremely well. It digs into the snow/ice, all while keeping your feet warm. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great Croc for Bad Weather

review.reviewBody: I love the ease of slipping them on. They are my new house slippers! I live in MN and this time of year they are a must have, wear them everyday, all day
review.name: Am buying a pair for my Son

name: All Terrain Lined Clog

hasVariant.description: Buy the Rapha Pro Team Training Bib Short - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Pro Team Training Bib Short - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I would never purchase one of these bibs again, nor would I recommend them to anyone else. 

I'm not a huge person (5'5, 155lbs-ish, size medium, athletic build), so maybe if I were bigger I wouldn't have the same issues. But when I say I had chaffing from this chamois in places I didn't think it was possible, I'm not exaggerating. The chamois is so large that I don't know who it would fit to be honest! I tried a using them on a long trail ride as well as for a ride on my indoor trainer, and in both cases it was painful. 

Run away from these!
review.name: Never again

name: Pro Team Training Bib Short - Women's

description: Buy the Backcountry Destination Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Destination Pant - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Backcountry Destination Pant - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My wife has these, they’re her go to for travel.  They’re extremely flattering on her figure, lightweight, and she shares very comfortable.  The waistband is supposed to sit a little higher over the tummy.  I wish they had more sizes.  I’d buy her more.

She’s put them through the wringer this past year traveling and hiking.  They’ve held up great.  Held up in normal wash cycles like any other piece of gear.

More colors and more sizes would be awesome.
review.name: Extremely Flattering / Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Almost kept these but decided not to. The waistband felt nice over the stomach after putting the pants on and while standing, but the bottom hem would cut into my stomach uncomfortably while bending or sitting. Minor complaint about the pockets--they bunch and flare out a bit if kept unzipped, which was unflattering. I appreciated the high waist as someone with a long torso, and they were stretchy but only felt nice while standing.
review.name: Uncomfortable waistband

review.reviewBody: The description says these run large, so size down. I would not do that. These came in fitting true to size. I like the flexibility of the pants, however there is no drawstring so keep that in mind!
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: I thought these would be great for fall hikes, but am returning them because of the odd fit.  They are very tight in the waist, but loose around the legs.  The fabric is thin and not very stretchy.  I’m a fan of the fleece-lined pants and was hoping they’d fit the same. Alas.
review.name: Returning before wearing

review.reviewBody:
These pants are made for stick legs. I tried in store and if the waist would fit they would be extremely tight on my calves. Waist is bunchy as others have pointed out.
Otherwise the material is great for hiking. Wouldn’t recommend to stand up to rock.
Still looking for a worthy successor to the Double Dyno pants you guys had a couple years ago.
review.name: Weird proportions

review.reviewBody: The material and look of this pant is great and I can imagine traveling and hiking in them often, but I couldn't get over the awkward fit. The waist is absurdly high with a shape that you would expect of a midrise pant, putting extra fabric around the lower stomach that doesn't flatter. Please remake in a different cut! So close..
review.name: Wanted to love..

review.reviewBody: Not sure if this is supposed to be super high waisted or have an awkwardly low crotch, very unflattering fit & construction. 3 back pockets was a good idea, except the material is already very loose (just received never washed/worn) and would not trust it to keep anything secure while walking/hiking. I ordered size small, 5’1” 120-125 lbs. I second the reviews that say big?, because the waist and length fit fine but there seems to be extra material in weird places. Thus the awkward construction. I much prefer my Mountain Hardware Dynama pants, if Backcountry could mirror that fit but use their materials I would be sold. Do not recommend, especially for the $55 + price tag. I expected better.
review.name: Awkward fit

review.reviewBody: They seemed big and just kind of a weird shape on me. However, I did a 6 hour hike in them and they were actually really comfortable.
review.name: Big?

review.reviewBody: Bought a size small (5'7'' 130lb) and it was too big. Returning for XS- The blue is pretty! The fabric is thinner than it looks around the waistband, not a thick tight waistband that holds everything in place (which I assumed it was by the pic).
review.name: Cute but runs big

review.reviewBody: The cut and fabric of these pants is great, but the brown color is not the deep, saturated hue as shown in the pic, it's kinda blah.
review.name: Brown Color not as pretty in person

name: Destination Pant - Women's
